intro: Thecacoris klainei, commonly known as the Klaine's thistle, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows as a shrub with spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is adapted to survive in dry environments with deep root systems and thick, waxy leaves to reduce water loss. Thecacoris klainei plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
